terms.definition: A pre-structured framework or blueprint that provides a standardized format for creating consistent training documentation across an organization.
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems.
The process of integrating new employees into an organization through structured training, documentation, and orientation materials.
A centralized web-based platform that organizes and provides access to all company documentation, training materials, and knowledge resources.
Dynamic components in documentation such as quizzes, exercises, clickable demos, or guided tours that engage users actively rather than passive reading.
A small software program that extends the functionality of the Google Chrome web browser, often used for documentation tools and screen capture.
A web page or content that is integrated directly into another website or platform using HTML code, allowing seamless display within existing systems.
A private network within an organization that uses internet technologies to share company information, documentation, and resources among employees.
Sales Development Representative - a sales role focused on prospecting and qualifying leads before passing them to account executives.
An interface or layout approach that prioritizes ease of use, intuitive navigation, and accessibility for the target audience.
Graphical elements such as diagrams, screenshots, videos, and infographics used to enhance understanding and retention in documentation.
The process of sharing information, skills, and expertise from one person or system to another through structured documentation and training.
Software that allows users to add notes, highlights, callouts, and markup to images, documents, or screenshots for instructional purposes.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to maintain multiple versions and revert to previous states.
The process of creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining digital content and documentation in a systematic and accessible way.
